LanguageData.Caffeine.label: caffeine
LanguageData.Caffeine.stages.0.label: wired
LanguageData.Caffeine.stages.1.label: jacked up
LanguageData.Caffeine.stages.2.label: blackout
LanguageData.CaffeineTolerance.label: caffeine tolerance
LanguageData.CaffeineTolerance.description: A built-up tolerance to caffeine. The more severe this tolerance is, the more caffeine it takes to get the same effect.
LanguageData.CaffeineTolerance.stages.0.label: small
LanguageData.CaffeineTolerance.stages.1.label: large
LanguageData.CaffeineTolerance.stages.2.label: massive
LanguageData.CaffeineAddiction.label: caffeine addiction
LanguageData.CaffeineAddiction.description: A chemical addiction to caffeine. Long-term presence of caffeine has caused neurological adaptations at the cellular level, so the brain can no longer function properly without the drug.\nWithout regular doses of caffeine, withdrawal symptoms will begin. However, extended abstinence will force the brain to adapt back to its normal state, resolving the addiction.
LanguageData.CaffeineAddiction.stages.1.label: withdrawal
